documents.document: @HWPCWX @jhatem yeah but i'm not sure you're right.. the data comes from 12z it's not fully processed until later.
@jhatem @HWPCWX got me. I thought SV was as fast as they come. it's starting now there.
@HWPCWX I think some is their prescribed update times... they aren't right after the main models.. so in these cases they are almost forced to lag, which isn't always the worst thing around here.
@HWPCWX should have waited with my tweet ;p

@megachris a lot of it is the beginning of upslope (orographic lift), there's a reason n md and the blue ridge region are favored in that sense... but it does also tend to matter where the storm is to a degree.. can see it on the coast.

@antmasiello yeah I'd have guessed but haven't looked too close yet. in this case I think there will be some overlap between that band and the best from the rest... somewhere near me for one maybe hah.
RT @antmasiello: @islivingston That early morning stuff has better lift in the DGZ throughout the area.

Last 4 runs of the at least somewhat more realistic hi rez NAM. Maybe too wet but everything is trending wetter into the end and the Euro is pretty close. As said yesterday... right where we wanted it. https://t.co/67R5SwfR03

@DTVaWeatherman numbers sure but spatially it's prob not terrible .. the nam is always too wet now it's more reasonably too wet but stuff has also been trending up so 1 in liquid isn't impossible locally.
I do continue to believe there is a reasonable chance we'll be near the out of elevation jackpot which is fun.

The NAM exists partly to keep us from throwing the GFS in the trash. Run to run changes are significant heh. 18z is a bit closer to consensus now tho, although 10 in DC might be hopeful. https://t.co/82ZvDaQjda
@greggadren Hah this area loves to oversalt

New NAM more or less held, minor shifts not worth too much thought. If the Euro holds I'd think winter storm warnings still get into DC. Seems fairly likely the max from the storm will try for our area. Elevation has best chance but could be immediate area. https://t.co/LyNMTfISOi
Pre-storm sunrise is often a winner. Can still see the moon out there tonight. Looks like a chance in the region tomorrow. Enjoy, early birds. ;) https://t.co/ECf9OHIztv
